title: How many times have you moved in your life? I have moved at least 36 times that I can recall. Has anyone else moved that much? - Quora

response.answer_text: I’m 15 and I have moved 31 times. I’ve lived in 4 countries. Which are: Ireland(8–9years), Germany(1 month) , Philippines(Several months), and USA(almost 4 years). All of these are in order. And now to connect them all together. I was born and mostly raised in Ireland, born in Dublin and raised in Dundalk and Dublin, its half in Dublin and half in Dundalk. At the age of three I moved with my mom to Frankfurt, Germany. We were staying with my aunty.2.And then moved back to Ireland, where my sister was born.And then at age 4+ we moved to Illigan, in the Philippines, stayed with me and my sisters grandparents, my sister was almost 1 at this time.And then moved back to Ireland. And then we moved around a bit in Ireland. Than in 2014 we moved to the United States.5. We were staying in St. Charles for a week plus. In our Uncles sisters apartment. 6. And then we moved to another house that we rented in St. Charles. 7. After that we moved to West Chicago, with a friend of my moms. 8. Then we moved to the country side of Poplar Bluff in Missouri for like 3 weeks. 9. And then we moved to Jacksonville, Florida. Where we stayed in motel 6 for like a month. It was there where my mom married an American. 10. And then we moved to a trailer in Jacksonville and rented it for like 6 months. 11. And then we moved to another trailer in the same trailer park. We moved because we were running out of money so we stayed in a room in a guys trailer. 12. And then we moved to a farm in Keystone Heights. 13. And then stayed in Gainesville, in a apartment. 14. And then moved back to the farm in Keystone Heights. 15. And then we moved back to the same house we rented in St. Charles. And stayed there longer than the last time which is about 2 months. 16. And then we moved back to the same house again in West Chicago. 17. And then we moved to my moms best friends house in Visalia, California. 18. Then we stayed in a distant relatives house in Elk Grove, California. 19. And then we were kicked out, so we stayed for a month in this nice El Salvadorian lady’s house in Sacramento. 20. And then we moved back to the house we were kicked out of in Elk Grove. And then we went homeless for a little while. 21. And then moved to an apartment that we rented for 2–3 months in Sacramento. It was there where my mom and stepdad separated and then later on divorced. He couldn’t take the moving and there was too much stress. 22. And then we moved to a mansion in Wayne, IL. It was the same woman who owned the house from West Chicago that we stayed in 2 times. But she moved to Wayne, and got a 12 bedroom house with a indoor pool and huge land. And then from fights between my mom and her we left. 23. We left to Scottsdale, Arizona. We stayed in someone’s house for a month. 24. And then we moved to a hotel for 3 months in Scottsdale. 25. And then we rented an apartment in Scottsdale for a couple of months. 26. And then we moved to Brookfield, IL. Where we rented for like 2 months. 27. And then we moved to Woodridge, IL. Where I’m currently staying right now. 28, 29, 30, 31. The four other times were when we moved back in forth in Ireland. Now I could of moved more in my life that I don’t know of. But these are the ones that I remember and have confirmed with my mom. I moved a lot in the USA but also a LOT in Ireland. So yeah, like I said it could be more. And now time to introduce myself. My name is Gabriel and my sister is Angelic but Angel for short. I am half Irish and half Filipino. My dad is Irish and my mom is Filipino. In my life my dad was never really there, he visited now and then but was never really there. I hope you enjoyed my life story. But this is only a quarter of my life. But still I hope you enjoyed.

I have moved a few times in my life. In the early years of my life my biofamily moved to 3 different places around Brisbane QLD. Then, between age 7 to 9 we lived at Palm Beach on the Goldcoast. The family moved to Kingscliff NSW for one term during year 9 at school before shifting back to Palm Beach Goldcoast. Two months before my twin and I’s birthday I was put into fostercare in Lismore NSW and stayed in the Northern NSW area. I was moved to 3 more homes until I found my forever home. When I moved out of the fosterhome I lived in a shared house with several other people. It was horrible as I waa being “touched up” by this man who didn’t understand english very well. I moved out soon after. I stayed at my exfoster parents place until I found a unit to move into. I have been at this unit for almost 6 years now. So by my count at 27 yro, I have lived at 12 different places.

1&2) My family moved twice when I was less than 3 years old (I don't remember the first two houses I lived in.) We stayed at the third house until I was 18. 3) We then moved one province over where I stayed with my uncle for a couple of months. I'm counting that as a move. 4) My family then moved into a town home, my mom and brother are still there today. 5) I moved out, by myself, 2 provinces over. I found a basement suite on Kijiji and got the landlord to pick me up from the bus station. It literally had a mattress. I stayed there a month while I found a better place. 6) I moved into another basement suite. The landlady was nice and became my friend. At that time I was considering moving provinces again, so when she got an offer from a coworker, he moved into the basement suite and I moved into a room, becoming her roommate instead. 7) I found another basement suite. It had more space, so I moved. It was a block and a half away. 8) I found a house for rent that had a basement suite. I convinced my best friend to rent it with me. I got the basement suite and she and her husband got the top. That's where I'm living now. Coincidentally, it was 6 houses down from the previous basement suite. So I've moved 8 times, nowhere close to 36. My mom, though, has probably moved 100+ times. Her Dad got bored easily, so her family would sometimes leave after only a month.

I am 24 and I will try to recollect from the times I remember . House 1 when I was around 3 years (I don’t remember how it look like, I just knew I was in a different house)House 2 moved to it at age of 4House 3 moved to it when I was 6House 4 moved to it when I was 8House 5 moved to it when I was 18Hostel life begins : moved from home to college in 20112012 moved to another comfortable hostel2013 moved to another hostel2014 moved to another hostel2015 moved back to home2015 moved to kochi2016 moved to home again2016 moved to Pune India for workMoved back to home in same year as I resigned the jobMoved to Brussels in Sep 2016 for masterMoved to Blois , France in Jan 2017July 2017 I moved back to Brussels for my internshipSept 2017- moved to Paris from Brussels for my third semester studiesI am still prepared to move next Feb 2018 but still don’t know where the location could be ;) Yeah life for me is always packing, unpacking . Only thing I hate is paper works! Everything else , am used to it.

We moved from my grandparent’s house to an apartment when I was 3, then to another apartment when I was about 4. After that, I moved to another town for university at 20. I spent a month living in an apartment my dad owned, then in the apartment he and his partner shared. Then they rented out a house that I lived in with them, for about a year, until I was 21 and moved out into the university dorm. Half a year later I moved in with my partner, that was in 2014. In 2015 we rented an apartment for a few months, and then moved out. This summer we bought an apartment of our own. This is alltogether 11 times, if my math is right. Chances are I’ll move around some more until I die.

To the best of my Knowledge, I have moved as a child and adult approximately 30 times. I say approx. due to not being absolutely certain as a baby from birth to 5 yrs old. Could be another 2 or 3 in there or not. 36 is a lot. You know living, say in a motel less than maybe 2 or 3 months or a car, tent, etc. is considered temporary. Lot of people who are doing that are not moving as such. My last big move was 17 years ago and I have been in the same house now for 17 1/2 years.

We moved 56 times by the time I was 16 years old…and at this point my count is up to 79. My Mother was a single Mom and just couldn't get settled. Moving gives experience, but it's also really unsettling emotionally. As an Adult I've tried to not move around so much but when you grow up all over the place it's hard to settle down. I want few things as much as a home now, but thus far I still don't have one.

I have, but have no idea of the number of times I've relocated because of jobs, itchy feet, temporary residences,etc. If I counted each boat I've owned as a separate residence, that's 26 right there. If every boat I've skippered, dozens more. Every ship or tugboat, dozens more. Every house or apartment, two or three dozen more, plus ranches, communes, vans, yurts, tents and tee pees, boarding houses, jails and prisons, military boarding schools, barracks. Hell, I've most likely left some places out. All in all, more than 36, lol.

My mom moved up to Rochester for a month when she gave birth to me. Then we moved to Texas for a year and a half. Then a trailer in Rochester. Then another trailer in a different neighborhood. Then I was in foster care for a while, but my dad got me out after two families and now I live with him. Not as much as you’ve moved, but there ya go.

I have moved so many times that I've stopped counting! Roughly, about 20 times. I've moved from Europe to the States twice. That's counted in the rough 20. Moving thirty-six times is a lot! I too led a nomadic life. I'm too tired to move again, and I'm happy where I am.
42 times: 11 times in the US1 time in Canada24 times in England6 times in GermanyThis covers 2 continents, 4 countries, and 24 cities.
I've never moved.. been in the same house all my life. Unfortunately I'm moving around march of next year.. moving up to cumming.
I have only moved 21 times so far.
